items.title: Trump announces deadly US strike on another alleged Venezuelan drug boat
items.standfirst: President says three people killed in strike against vessel he said was transporting drugs ‘headed to the US’Donald Trump said on Monday that the United States had carried out a strike on a second Venezuelan boat and killed three alleged terrorists he claimed were transporting drugs, expanding his administration’s war against drug cartels and the scope of lethal military force to stop them.The US president gave few details about the strike, saying in a social media post that the action was on his orders and that it had happened earlier in the morning. The post was accompanied by a video clip showing the boat, which appeared to be stationary, erupting into a fireball. Continue reading...
items.content: President says three people killed in strike against vessel he said was transporting drugs ‘headed to the US’Donald Trump said on Monday that the United States had carried out a strike on a second Venezuelan boat and killed three alleged terrorists he claimed were transporting drugs, expanding his administration’s war against drug cartels and the scope of lethal military force to stop them.The US president gave few details about the strike, saying in a social media post that the action was on his orders and that it had happened earlier in the morning. The post was accompanied by a video clip showing the boat, which appeared to be stationary, erupting into a fireball. Continue reading...

items.content: President Donald Trump alleged that "narcoterrorists" were on the boat and that they were carrying illegal drugs destined for the United States.

clusters.title: Israel launches ground offensive in Gaza City
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel Launches Ground Offensive in Gaza City

items.title: Israel launches ground offensive in Gaza City
items.standfirst: Thousands of Palestinians fled from Gaza City after Israel launched a ground offensive. It comes as a new report today from an independent United Nations commission concluded Israel is committing genocide. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports.
items.content: Thousands of Palestinians fled from Gaza City after Israel launched a ground offensive. It comes as a new report today from an independent United Nations commission concluded Israel is committing genocide. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports.

items.title: Ex-Israeli PM Naftali Bennett on Gaza City offensive, U.N. commission genocide report and more
items.standfirst: As Israel launches a ground offensive to take Gaza City, a U.N. commission concluded Tuesday that the country is committing genocide in the Palestinian territory. Israel has dismissed the claims. Former Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett joins "The Takeout" to discuss the operation and to address the report.
items.content: As Israel launches a ground offensive to take Gaza City, a U.N. commission concluded Tuesday that the country is committing genocide in the Palestinian territory. Israel has dismissed the claims. Former Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett joins "The Takeout" to discuss the operation and to address the report.

items.title: Israel Committing Genocide in Gaza Says UN Commission
items.standfirst: Israel rejects UN Commission finding that it is committing genocide in Gaza.
items.content: Israel rejects UN Commission finding that it is committing genocide in Gaza.

items.title: Israel launches ground offensive deep inside Gaza City
items.standfirst: IDF says advance aims to ‘dismantle Hamas’s grip’ as UN report says Israel has committed genocide in territoryIsrael unleashed its long-threatened ground offensive in Gaza City on Tuesday, sending tanks and remote-controlled armoured cars packed with explosives into its streets, in defiance of international criticism and the findings of a UN commission that it was committing genocide in the Palestinian territory.“Gaza is burning. The IDF is striking terror infrastructure with an iron fist,” Israel’s defence minister, Israel Katz, wrote on X as the attack was launched in the early hours of the morning, adding: “We will not relent until the mission is completed.” Continue reading...
items.content: IDF says advance aims to ‘dismantle Hamas’s grip’ as UN report says Israel has committed genocide in territoryIsrael unleashed its long-threatened ground offensive in Gaza City on Tuesday, sending tanks and remote-controlled armoured cars packed with explosives into its streets, in defiance of international criticism and the findings of a UN commission that it was committing genocide in the Palestinian territory.“Gaza is burning. The IDF is striking terror infrastructure with an iron fist,” Israel’s defence minister, Israel Katz, wrote on X as the attack was launched in the early hours of the morning, adding: “We will not relent until the mission is completed.” Continue reading...

items.title: Israel launches ground offensive on Gaza City
items.standfirst: It comes as a UN commission of inquiry found that Israel was committing genocide in Gaza.
items.content: It comes as a UN commission of inquiry found that Israel was committing genocide in Gaza.

items.title: Gaza City under relentless bombardment as Israel launches ground invasion
items.standfirst: The UN chief calls Gaza situation 'horrendous' as a UN inquiry concludes that Israel’s two-year war is genocide.
items.content: The UN chief calls Gaza situation 'horrendous' as a UN inquiry concludes that Israel’s two-year war is genocide.

items.title: Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, says UN commission of inquiry
items.standfirst: Report cites scale of killings and aid blockages, and calls on member countries to punish those responsibleA UN commission has found that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, citing tens of thousands of civilian deaths and massive destruction, and has called on member countries to punish those responsible for it.The United Nations independent international commission of inquiry (COI), which does not speak on behalf of the UN, found that “genocide is occurring in Gaza and is continuing to occur”, said its head, Navi Pillay. Continue reading...
items.content: Report cites scale of killings and aid blockages, and calls on member countries to punish those responsibleA UN commission has found that Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, citing tens of thousands of civilian deaths and massive destruction, and has called on member countries to punish those responsible for it.The United Nations independent international commission of inquiry (COI), which does not speak on behalf of the UN, found that “genocide is occurring in Gaza and is continuing to occur”, said its head, Navi Pillay. Continue reading...

items.title: A U.N. inquiry accuses Israel of genocide in Gaza, joining a rising chorus
items.standfirst: The report issued Tuesday by experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council calls on the international community to end the genocide and take steps to punish those responsible.
items.content: The report issued Tuesday by experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council calls on the international community to end the genocide and take steps to punish those responsible.(Image credit: Yousef Al Zanoun)

items.title: Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, UN commission of inquiry says
items.standfirst: The panel finds that four of the five genocidal acts defined under international law have been carried out against Palestinians during the war.
items.content: The panel finds that four of the five genocidal acts defined under international law have been carried out against Palestinians during the war.

items.title: Bowen: UN commission report on genocide is blunt indictment of Israel's actions in Gaza
items.standfirst: A new report accuses Israel of committing genocide in Gaza, in "the strongest and most authoritative UN finding to date".
items.content: A new report accuses Israel of committing genocide in Gaza, in "the strongest and most authoritative UN finding to date".

items.title: UN Commission says Israel is committing genocide in Gaza
items.standfirst: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, according to a commission established by the United Nations.
items.content: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, according to a commission established by the United Nations.

Israel's military aims to dismantle Hamas's grip in Gaza City with the offensive.

items.title: Kenya seeks British national’s arrest in septic tank murder

items.content: In 2012, the body of Agnes Wanjiru was found in a septic tank at the Lion’s Court Hotel in central Nanyuki.

items.title: Kenya seeks arrest of former British soldier over alleged murder of Agnes Wanjiru
items.standfirst: High court judge issues arrest warrant, saying a suspect has been charged in relation to 2012 death of 21-year-oldProfile: who was Agnes Wanjiru?A warrant has been issued for the arrest of a British national on suspicion of the murder of the Kenyan woman Agnes Wanjiru, who was found dead in the grounds of a hotel near an army base in 2012.The high court judge Alexander Muteti issued the arrest warrant earlier on Tuesday in Kenya, with the prosecution telling the court a suspect had been charged with murder, and his extradition to Kenya was being sought. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Spain first of Eurovision ‘big five’ to say it will boycott event if Israel participates
clusters.neutral_headline: Spain May Boycott Eurovision if Israel Participates

items.title: Spain first of Eurovision ‘big five’ to say it will boycott event if Israel participates
items.standfirst: Head of state broadcaster says it is ‘impossible to look the other way’ over Israel’s actions in GazaSpain has become the latest country to confirm it will not take part in next year’s Eurovision song contest if Israel participates, with the head of its state broadcaster saying “the genocide currently taking place make[s] it impossible for us to look the other way”.The majority decision by RTVE board members makes Spain the first of the “big five” Eurovision countries that contribute the most money to the event to take such action in response to Israel’s offensive in Gaza. Continue reading...
items.content: Head of state broadcaster says it is ‘impossible to look the other way’ over Israel’s actions in GazaSpain has become the latest country to confirm it will not take part in next year’s Eurovision song contest if Israel participates, with the head of its state broadcaster saying “the genocide currently taking place make[s] it impossible for us to look the other way”.The majority decision by RTVE board members makes Spain the first of the “big five” Eurovision countries that contribute the most money to the event to take such action in response to Israel’s offensive in Gaza. Continue reading...

items.title: Empty Tables, Low Margins Show Cost of China’s Food Delivery War

items.standfirst: As Chinese consumers snag 14-cent coffees and 50-cent meals thanks to a fierce price war among food delivery platforms, restaurants and tea chains are counting the cost of vanishing footfalls.
items.content: As Chinese consumers snag 14-cent coffees and 50-cent meals thanks to a fierce price war among food delivery platforms, restaurants and tea chains are counting the cost of vanishing footfalls.

The price war is impacting foot traffic.

clusters.title: Parents Slam OpenAI, Character.AI Over Safety in Senate Hearing
clusters.neutral_headline: Parents Raise Concerns About AI Safety in Senate Hearing

items.title: Parents Slam OpenAI, Character.AI Over Safety in Senate Hearing
Parents Slam OpenAI, Character.AI Over Safety in Senate Hearing
items.standfirst: The father of a teenager who died by suicide this spring delivered emotional congressional testimony Tuesday, alleging OpenAI’s ChatGPT “groomed” his 16-year-old son to take his own life and the company prioritized speed and market share over youth safety.
items.content: The father of a teenager who died by suicide this spring delivered emotional congressional testimony Tuesday, alleging OpenAI’s ChatGPT “groomed” his 16-year-old son to take his own life and the company prioritized speed and market share over youth safety.

ai_summary: Parents testified before the Senate about the dangers of AI platforms for children.
One father alleged ChatGPT "groomed" his son, leading to suicide.
He claimed OpenAI prioritized speed and market share over safety.
The hearing focused on the potential risks associated with AI technology.
Parents expressed concerns about the impact of AI on young people.

clusters.title: IEA Reverses Course on Oil and Gas Investment
clusters.neutral_headline: IEA Revises Oil and Gas Investment Stance

items.title: IEA Reverses Course on Oil and Gas Investment
items.standfirst: The world needs to develop new oil and gas resources just to keep output flat amid faster declining rates at existing fields, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Tuesday in a major shift in its narrative from 2021 that ‘no new investment’ is needed in a net-zero by 2050 scenario. The…
items.content: The world needs to develop new oil and gas resources just to keep output flat amid faster declining rates at existing fields, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Tuesday in a major shift in its narrative from 2021 that ‘no new investment’ is needed in a net-zero by 2050 scenario. The…

items.title: World Must Spend $540 Billion a Year Looking for Oil and Gas, IEA Says
items.standfirst: The world needs to spend some $540 billion a year looking for oil and gas to maintain current output by 2050 as the pace of declines in existing fields increases, according to the International Energy Agency.
items.content: The world needs to spend some $540 billion a year looking for oil and gas to maintain current output by 2050 as the pace of declines in existing fields increases, according to the International Energy Agency.

ai_summary: The IEA now says new oil and gas investment is needed to maintain output.
This is a shift from their 2021 stance of no new investment for net-zero.
The agency estimates $540 billion annually is needed for oil and gas exploration.
This investment is needed to offset declining production from existing fields.
The IEA's revised stance reflects changing energy market dynamics.

items.content: Microsoft Corp. will invest $30 billion in the UK as part of a push to expand artificial intelligence infrastructure and build the country’s largest supercomputer.

The supercomputer will support AI demand and adoption in the UK.
This investment is part of Microsoft's broader AI expansion strategy.

The alternative bill is a short-term spending measure.
Republicans released a short-term bill to fund the government.

clusters.title: Teenagers and their parents get huge fine for online video restaurant 'prank'
clusters.neutral_headline: Teenagers and Parents Fined for Restaurant Prank

items.title: Teenagers and their parents get huge fine for online video restaurant 'prank'
items.standfirst: Two teenagers who filmed themselves urinating into a restaurant's hotpot broth have been ordered, along with their parents, to apologise and pay a fine of £227,000, Chinese state media has said.
items.content: Two teenagers who filmed themselves urinating into a restaurant's hotpot broth have been ordered, along with their parents, to apologise and pay a fine of £227,000, Chinese state media has said.

items.title: Teens who peed into a hotpot, and their parents, must pay $300K, Chinese court orders
items.standfirst: A pair of teenagers who filmed themselves peeing into a hotpot broth have been ordered, along with their parents, to pay more than $300,000 by a court in China.
items.content: A pair of teenagers who filmed themselves peeing into a hotpot broth have been ordered, along with their parents, to pay more than $300,000 by a court in China.

ai_summary: Two teenagers filmed themselves urinating in a hotpot broth.
They and their parents were ordered to apologize and pay a fine.
The fine amounts to approximately $300,000.
The incident occurred at a restaurant.
Chinese state media reported the court's decision.

items.content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday that his Russian and Ukrainian counterparts “hate each other” and he’s stuck in the middle

items.title: Bristling with frustration - Zelenskyy's message is clear
items.standfirst: Ukraine's president has a very clear message for Donald Trump - you alone have the power to stop Vladimir Putin, and the time to act is now.
items.content: Ukraine's president has a very clear message for Donald Trump - you alone have the power to stop Vladimir Putin, and the time to act is now.

ai_summary: Ukraine wants Trump to take a clear position on Russia.
Zelenskyy believes Trump can stop Putin.
Trump said his Russian and Ukrainian counterparts "hate each other".
Trump stated he is stuck in the middle of the conflict.
Ukraine's message is that Trump has the power to act.
